column4: i have a question... i've got a directory with hundreds of files in it-all named differently(obviously), but some contain the same content. can anyone suggest a quick way of identifying the duplicates (something diff-like) ??
diff ;)  are they exact duplicates?  you could then use hashes, aslso
so - shell script along the lines of 'foreach file in directory, diffit against all the other files?
jrib has a good idea about using filesizes to narrow down the candidate field
if they're completely identical, you can make hashes for all of them (will take a little while) and compare
if they're going to be the _exact_ same content, use the filesize
all the darn ops are sleeping or something
yeah, it's not clever
but they are quite simple
lol, samba and I just don't get along
i dont dance either ;)
at least it didnt cost you $$ though, just time
yeah, that's true... and I think probably some sleep, most likely
have you ever managed to get a dual graphics card xserver? i have a pci nvidia graphics card, and i'm considering adding it to my exiting pcie card so i can add a third monitor. doable?
yeah, I had an ATI Radeon + Onboard Intel setup at one time, worked fine/great
the new autoconfig for Xorg.conf files doesn't support more than two monitors... mine was done back when there was /no/ decent autoconfig, so I had to write my xorg entirely by hand
how about desktop candy?
lol with all that power, I'm sure you'll be fine
I had compiz running for a while, cube on each monitor
now I just use a TV as my second monitor and I only use it when I'm playing something on it

yeah - what i would like to do, is have a dedicated 3d accelerated monitor which is not impeded by candy - so i dont have problems with games. i still have soft crashes sometimes when i maximise games- they just dont handle 2 monitors well, sometimes crashing, sometimes maximising to both, etc etc... and performance is hit by having to draw the other monitor on the same gfx card...
true... I never play games anymore, so i donno about that
I spent about 15 minutes trying to get The Sims running about a week ago, and just gave up
the sims?! i'd rather watch crap accumulating in my keyboard
